poem:
Returns on the Mic

This morning's paper rustles—
LL's words uplift like a seashell held to the ear.
No more underdogs, no more broken chains.
Hip-hop, a chameleon, now gilded.
Still speaking truth, still the airwaves
of our time—each artist a solitary anchor
in the ocean of rhythm.
